title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana State University
Interview Descriptions:
Very personable and smooth interview process. Casual questions that inquire about your employment history, capabilities to complete tasks, why you are interested in a GA, and general career goals. 
An advisor reaches out to schedule a virtual interview. Typically their response time is fast. You may also mention that you are looking for a GA during the admission process
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in a Graduate Assistantship

title: GA of Information and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Work directly with the Dean of the College of Health and Human Services for two in-depth interviews. The dean is professional, inquisitive, kind, and interested in the growth of a candidate.
Interview Questions:
What are your qualifications?
What would you get out of the position?
Are you comfortable working remotely?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very formal, friendly and respectful. Panel usually makes you feel very comfortable.  Questions are easy to understand and very relatable to real life experiences. They key is that one must be always prepared to answer any question to the fullest of their abilities.
Interview Questions: What leadership qualities makes you unique among your peers?

title: Executive Director of Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was comprehensive, lasting 4 months and involving a day presenting/interviewing on campus. While on campus, I met with 5-6 groups of people, had lunch with the marketing group, met with the president and presented to 50-60 on marketing approach.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were standard for higher education marketing and ranged from leadership acumen to dealing with difficult people/stress to marketing strategy.

title: Sponsorship Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with a panel of 3-5 people over Zoom. They started the interview by going over the position requirements and then went into asking questions.  The team interviewing consisted of positions both above and below the roll I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What was your largest sponsorship account?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana State University in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Casual, yet very professional. It took place under COVID protocols where masks and social distancing were required. Overall, It was a very smooth process where the interviewer was very attentive and asked great questions.
Interview Questions: How will this job prepare you for your career outside of Indiana State University?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Went very well for a phone interview, it was around 10 min in length. Not very long to get through questions asked. Phone interviews can be hard. It seemed to go well but did not receive a call back.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at ISU

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had to respond to a 'student email' initially, then my in person interview consisted of two interviews with two panels- one of department heads, and the other with the current counselors, and finally I had to give an elevator pitch presentation on why you should attend ISU.
Interview Questions: (Because they deal with so many first generation college attendees) What do you wish someone would have told you before entering college?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana State University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Application process where candidates apply online with personal school information and grades. Then there is an in person review with the board of the department you are applying for where they ask why and further personal information.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the school?

title: Employer Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview to screen candidates and later an in person interview with the department. The review team consisted of the team I would work for an a few other employees from other departments.
Interview Questions: What I did in my free time.

title: Assistant Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Assistant Hall Director/Full Time Graduate Student
• Manage day-to-day operations of Indiana State Sophomore Residential Hall supporting
~350+ Freshman Students Residential Hall w/ 3 different communities 7 Floors of Athletes, Global living floors (M&F), & 2 International floors. (2019-2020)
~400+ students. (2018-2019)
Interview Questions: What are your skills in this?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Friendly but it was via zoom so I couldn't get a good feel for the true collegiality of the college and or department. They were timely and respectful. I didn't continue with an in person interview as offered because I accepted another position elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself? How do you fit in here?

title: Systems Integrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana State University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, very comfortable. No pressure, round table talks about various topics, and a range of personality questions, as well as technical questions, and organization method questions. Met with director first, then a search panel of 4, followed by majority of people in the department in an informal discussion.
Interview Questions: What are your outside projects, if any.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN)
Interview Descriptions: You are called in for an interview and you are interviewed by three supervisors. Each supervisors takes time to talk and ask you questions. The process was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: basic questions about previous work experience and yourself.

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with director and supervisor in an office setting. Both took turns asking questions they thought were of importance. Then they gave me a tour of the facility, introduced me to other teachers I would be working with, and allowed me to sit and observe daily activities.
Interview Questions: How do you navigate language barriers between family and caregiver?

title: IT Systems Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not hard at all. By me living in Terre haute already, there was no need to be flown out for an interview, although tey would have if necessary. The interview itself lasted 45 minutes, with only about 10-12 questions. Some questions specific, but mostly asking what I knew in terms of business processes in general and knwoledge of the field. The hiring process itself only took a month to a month and a half.
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out compared to most applicants?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN)
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by 3 people. 2 of which were senior student workers. Questions were based off of my past experience. The interviewer was looking at my resume and asking about different experiences that were on there.
It was a god interview in general. All interviewers were friendly.
I had only one interview and I heard back within a few days.
Interview Questions: Many of the questions were based off of my past experience.

title: Laboratory Teaching Assistant (Student Position) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview.  The professors usually are familiar with your work ethic and will select you based on that and what you apply for.  If they know you are a good student and perform well in class, they assume that you will also perform well in a student job position.  You are more likely to get a position if you know the professor well.
Interview Questions: No questions were asked.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief. The interviewers were straight-forward and very friendly. The final result was posted and sent via email, which took about 4-6 days. Once I was accepted, I was invited for training and completing necessary paper work.
Interview Questions: Common interview questions. Also posed situational questions, such as how to answer appropriately when the topic of alcohol on campus was brought up; or what you love the most/ the reason made you decided to come to ISU.

title: NSF Undergrad Research Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The employer asked me if I would be interested if i joined. He asked me my background with both electronics and automotive. I was in a group of awesome people in the class already and considered one of the top students.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions.

title: Student Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana State University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, come in, answere some simple questions, no silly tactics to make you feel nervous.
Interview Questions: What do you know about computers?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana State University (Terre Haute, IN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very traditional. Nothing was out of the ordinary
Interview Questions: Actually it was a little too easy.
